ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Advanced Conversational really expands one's vocabulary and ability to have serious conversations in Spanish. It goes beyond the typical "hi how are you" conversation of past classes and addresses questions of justice, ethics and morals. I liked the class and if you're interested in cementing your Spanish abilities, definitely take this class.
If you want to have a class to maintain your Spanish speaking skills, this is the class for you.
Good class, not a ton of work. Good for maintaining fluency but might not help you improve all that much.

It was a solid course that was pretty straightforward if you have a good hold on spanish. There are still homework assignments and quizzes, as well as a lot of on-the-spot talking. The midterms and finals are all oral. Class participation is a huge part of your grade. Professor Carballal is one of the less animated professors in the department, so shop around to see if another one fits you better and makes the class more fun.
I have already recommended this course to several fellow students. As well as being one of the more enjoyable language classes I have taken, it is a great way to focus on one's speaking skills.
Good way to maintain Spanish speaking skills. May not result in strong improvement.
